description.@value: This crumbled apple cake might sound fancy, but it’s actually ridiculously easy – so much so that you need pretty much no baking ability whatsoever. It’s sort of an apple crumble / apple cake hybrid, consisting of a layer of cake at the bottom, then a layer of spiced apples, and finished off with a crumbly streusel-like topping. The simplicity of this recipe becomes apparent when you realise that the recipe for the cakey bottom layer is actually identical to the crumble topping – how it works, I have no idea, but somehow it transforms into two different things as it cooks. Must be some sort of magic.

ingredients.@value:
Ingredients
200 g flour
100 ml maple syrup
60 g of coconut oil from the fridge
2 teaspoons cinnamon
3 Golden Delicious apples
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Preheat oven to 180 ° C (350F).

	
 
	
	 

	
InstructionsRub the  coconut oil and the flour together, then add the maple syrup and 1 teaspoon cinamon, and mix well with a fork to form a breadcrumb-like mixture . Peel and core the apples, and cut them into slices. Add them in to the bowl with the cinnamon an lemon juice.
Press two-thirds of the cake mixture into the cake tin lined with parchment paper , and add the apples in a slightly rounded heap. Then sprinkle the remaining cake mixture around the sides and over the top of the apples.
Bake for around 60 minutes, or until golden brown. Leave it to cool in the tin and then remove and slice.



 			
				 POrzioni : 
				 8  
			
						
				  Pronto in :				  75 Minuti  
			
			

Portata :    Desserts

Press two-thirds of the cake mixture into the cake tin lined with parchment paper , and add the apples in a slightly rounded heap. Then sprinkle the remaining cake mixture around the sides and over the top of the apples.
Bake for around 60 minutes, or until golden brown. Leave it to cool in the tin and then remove and slice.
